026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns;
027
028import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
029
030/**
031 * Abstract pattern class for an operator that produces tuples on output
032 * streams using a single process method.
033 * 
034 * @see #process()
035 */
036public abstract class ProcessTupleProducer extends TupleProducer {
037   
038    private Thread processThread;
039    
040    /**
041     * {@inheritDoc}
042     * Create the non-daemon thread used to call the process() method.
043     * The thread is created during initialization to ensure that the SPL runtime
044     * will wait upon its completion before completing the operator.
045     * The thread is started by <code>startProcessing</code> which
046     * means the initial delay support provided by the super-class
047     * <code>TupleProducer</code> is honored.
048     * 
049     */
050    @Override
051    public synchronized void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
052        super.initialize(context);
053        
054        /*
055         * Create the thread at initialize time but do not start it.
056         * The thread will be started by startProcessing() which will
057         * be called at allPortsReady() time if no delay is specified,
058         * otherwise it will be called once the delay has expired.
059         */
060        processThread = getOperatorContext().getThreadFactory().newThread(
061                new Runnable() {
062
063                    @Override
064                    public void run() {
065                        try {
066                            process();
067                        } catch (Exception e) {
068                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
069                        }
070                    }
071                    
072                });
073        
074        /*
075         * Set the thread not to be a daemon to ensure that the SPL runtime
076         * will wait for the thread to complete before determining the
077         * operator is complete.
078         */
079        processThread.setDaemon(false);
080    }
081    
082    /**
083     * Disallow use of deprecated method by a sub-class.
084     * @deprecated
085     */
086    @Override
087    @Deprecated
088    protected final void producerInitialize() {
089    }
090
091
092    /**
093     * Starts processing by starting the thread that will
094     * call process().
095     */
096    protected synchronized void startProcessing() {
097        processThread.start();
098    }
099    
100    /**
101     * Sub-classes provide a process() method that submits tuples
102     * on the operator's output ports.
103     * <BR>
104     * When this method returns the the operator will complete.
105     * <P>
106     * It is guaranteed that the <code>initialize()</code> method <i>happens-before</i>
107     * the <code>process()</code> method for purposes of memory visibility.
108     * </P>
109     * 
110     * @throws Exception Exception is sub-class processing
111     */
112    protected abstract void process() throws Exception;
113
114    /**
115     * Shutdown this operator, which will interrupt the thread
116     * executing the <code>process()</code> method.
117     * <P>
118     * Sub-classes <b>must</b> call
119     * <code>super.shutdown()</code> if they override this method.
120     * </P>
121     */
122    @Override
123    public synchronized void shutdown() throws Exception {
124        if (processThread != null) {
125            processThread.interrupt();
126            processThread = null;
127        }
128        
129        super.shutdown();
130    }
131}
